dove.util.ui.progress

Class CirculateLoading

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • dove.util.ui.progress.CirculateLoading
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, javax.accessibility.Accessible 

    public class CirculateLoading
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.lang.Runnable
    provides a component that displays the default circular loading sign
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  CirculateLoading.SPEED
      defines the speed of the dots the higher the value, the longer the time between repaints/the slower the loading icon

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class javax.swing.JPanel

        javax.swing.JPanel.AccessibleJPanel

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class javax.swing.JComponent

        javax.swing.JComponent.AccessibleJComponent

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.awt.Container

        java.awt.Container.AccessibleAWTContainer

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.awt.Component

        java.awt.Component.AccessibleAWTComponent, java.awt.Component.BaselineResizeBehavior, java.awt.Component.BltBufferStrategy, java.awt.Component.FlipBufferStrategy

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean clockwise
      determines wether the dots move clockwise or the revers way
      private java.awt.Color[] ptColors
      the color of the dots that are displayed the further the dot is away from the first dot, the brighter its color is
      private int ptSize
      the radius of the dots
      private double radPos
      the position of the first dot start with the first dot upside value in rad
      private double radSize
      the percentage of the whole panel the circle upon which the dots move uses (take the size of the dots in calculation they will be only displayed half if radSize == 1)
      private int radSizeReal
      the real radSize if this is -1, radSize is used
      boolean runLoad
      if true, the dots are moving can be set false to kill the moving thread
      CirculateLoading.SPEED speed
      the speed at which the dots are moving (@see dove.util.ui.progress.CirculateLoading$Speed)
      private double stepSize
      the size at which dots will step calculated in the constructor
      int totalDots
      the number of total dots for example totalDots == 4 means the dots move a quarter circle every clocktick
      static int user
      the user speed this speed can be defined by the user here (@see dove.util.ui.progress.CirculateLoading$Speed)
      int visibleDots
      the number of visible dots

      • Fields inherited from class javax.swing.JComponent

        listenerList, TOOL_TIP_TEXT_KEY, ui, UNDEFINED_CONDITION, WHEN_ANCESTOR_OF_FOCUSED_COMPONENT, WHEN_FOCUSED, WHEN_IN_FOCUSED_WINDOW

      • Fields inherited from class java.awt.Component

        accessibleContext, BOTTOM_ALIGNMENT, CENTER_ALIGNMENT, LEFT_ALIGNMENT, RIGHT_ALIGNMENT, TOP_ALIGNMENT

      • Fields inherited from interface java.awt.image.ImageObserver

        ABORT, ALLBITS, ERROR, FRAMEBITS, HEIGHT, PROPERTIES, SOMEBITS, WIDTH

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CirculateLoading()
      creates a default loading token
      CirculateLoading(int totalDots, int visibleDots, int dotSize, double radSize, boolean clockwise, CirculateLoading.SPEED speed)
      creates a circulateloading sign from the give arguments and sets up all constants needed to display
      CirculateLoading(int totalDots, int visibleDots, int dotSize, int radSize, boolean clockwise, CirculateLoading.SPEED speed)
      sets up a circulate loading token only difference to the next constructor: the radSize is absolute (in pixel)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void createDotColors()
      creates the dotColors for each dot by the given foreground color every dot-color is a bit more brighter than the previous one so color[visibledot colors + 1] would be white (255 , 255 , 255) if existent
      void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
      displays every dot dots are calculated from the dotpos via unit circle
      void run()
      moves the position of the first dot the specified stepSize and repaints
      void setForeground(java.awt.Color color)
      the foreground is set for this component and all dotcolors are updated (@see createDotColors())

      • CirculateLoading

        public CirculateLoading(int totalDots,
                        int visibleDots,
                        int dotSize,
                        int radSize,
                        boolean clockwise,
                        CirculateLoading.SPEED speed)
        sets up a circulate loading token only difference to the next constructor: the radSize is absolute (in pixel)
        Parameters:
        totalDots -
        visibleDots -
        dotSize -
        radSize -
        clockwise -
        speed -

      • CirculateLoading

        public CirculateLoading(int totalDots,
                        int visibleDots,
                        int dotSize,
                        double radSize,
                        boolean clockwise,
                        CirculateLoading.SPEED speed)
        creates a circulateloading sign from the give arguments and sets up all constants needed to display
        Parameters:
        totalDots - number of dots the circle consists off
        visibleDots - number of visible dots
        dotSize - radius of a dot
        radSize - percentage of how much of the space of the component is used by the circle
        clockwise - true if the circle spins clockwise
        speed - the speed the clock spins with

    • Method Detail

      • setForeground

        public void setForeground(java.awt.Color color)
        the foreground is set for this component and all dotcolors are updated (@see createDotColors())
        Overrides:
        setForeground in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        color - the new foreground color

      • createDotColors

        private void createDotColors()
        creates the dotColors for each dot by the given foreground color every dot-color is a bit more brighter than the previous one so color[visibledot colors + 1] would be white (255 , 255 , 255) if existent
